summary:
I am a lecturer in European Studies at the University of Amsterdam. In this position I am jointly convening several courses revolving around EU Enlargement and External Relations, European Geopolitics, European Integration and Skills Seminar Brussels. In addition, I have taught seminars for the course Middle East: History, Politics and Economy and am a MA thesis supervisor. I have several years of experience as a module convenor of a variety of courses in both the United Kingdom (Durham University) and the Netherlands (University of Groningen). In these courses I have covered several subjects such as politics, political economy, state-society relations and international relations in the Middle East as well as supervising Bachelor and Master Students in Middle Eastern Studies (University of Groningen) and Politics (Durham University). Throughout these years I have distinguished myself as a lecturer by implementing active learning methods in my courses, which has resulted in excellent student reviews about the quality of my teaching. 

As a scholar my research revolves around state-society relations, political economy and international relations in the Gulf region. I obtained my doctoral degree in Middle Eastern Politics at the University in Exeter in March 2020 (after passing the Viva without corrections) with a thesis on the the impact of Internet technology on the Gulf monarchies focusing on Kuwait and Oman. I have presented my work at various conferences and had a number of publications in the International Spectator, edited volumes, Gulf Insight, the HH Sheikh Nasser Mohammad al-Sabah Publication Series and ZemZem. Alongside this,  I have frequently contributed to Gulf State News providing political analysis on Kuwait and have initiated several extra-cirricular activies including being co-organiser of the Gulf Conference 2016 (University of Exeter) and co-founding the Social Movement Theory Reading Group at the University of Exeter.

treasury_media.title: UAE's withdrawal from the GCC Monetary Union
treasury_media.description: My awarded Master Dissertation on UAE's withdrawal from the GCC Monetary Union. In this Dissertation, I argue that the UAE did withdrawn because of the decision to locate the central bank in Riyadh. With the UAE carving out an independent role for itself and seeing itself as an example for the other GCC states, it could not accept Saudi insistence locating the central bank in Riyadh. The economic benefits of the Monetary Union were not sufficient for the UAE to stay in the GCC Monetary Union.

profile_positions.description:
-Joint Module coordinator for EU Enlargement and External Relations, European Geopolitics, European Integration and Skills Seminar Brussels 
- Seminar group lecturer Middle East: History, Politics and Economy
- Tutor 1st year BA students European Studies & MA European Policy
- MA thesis advisor
profile_positions.title: Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
As a Lecturer in Middle Eastern Studies I had a wide range of responsibilities, including: 

- Module convenor of the following modules: Countries & Societies of the Middle East (1st-year BA  Middle Eastern Studies), History of the Contemporary Middle East (1st-year BA  Middle Eastern Studies), Violence and Conflict Management in the Middle East (3rd-year BA Middle Eastern Studies), International Organisations and the Middle East (MA Middle Eastern Studies).
- Supervision of 8 Bachelor Dissertations and 4 MA Dissertations
- Secretary of the Education Committee of Middle Eastern Studies
- Member of MA Admission Committee for Middle Eastern Studies
profile_positions.title: Lecturer

profile_positions.description: Doctoral researcher conducting research on the impact of Internet technology in Kuwait and Oman. I have presented my research at various conference and workshops, including the Middle East and North Africa Workshop of the American Political Science Association (2016), the British Society for Middle Eastern Studies Conference (in 2016 & 2017) and the Gulf Conference (2017). At the University of Exeter, I recently co-founded a reading group on Social Movement Theory which introduces PGR students to the most  important concepts within Social Movement Theory. I am also a contributor to the Gulf States News,  while I have published a chapter on Oman-Iran relations for the book 'Iran's relations with the Arab states of the Gulf' (2016).
profile_positions.title: PhD candidate

profile_positions.description: As a Postgraduate Teaching Assistant, I taught two tutorials for the course 'Contemporary Theories of World Politics,' a second year Politics course on International Relations. In the tutorials I included discussions, debate and case-studies to make them interactive. Simultaneously, I advised my students regarding essay-writing and graded the exams and essays for the course.
profile_positions.title: Postgraduate Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description:
As a Teaching Fellow in Middle East Politics I had a wide range of responsibilities, including: 

- Module convenor of the Middle East's Oil Monarchies (68 Bachelor students). In this position I developed this year's handbook, have been responsible for the design and content of the lectures & seminars and did set the essay questions for the module.
- Module convenor of Political Economy of Development in the Middle East (12 Master students). In this position I developed this year's handbook, have been responsible for the content of the seminars and I did set the essay questions for the module.
- Bachelor and Master Dissertation supervision
- Secretary of the Post-Graduate Board of Examiners. As a secretary and member of the board I help to assess requests for mitigation on the basis of Serious Adverse Circumstances, plagiarism cases and essay & exam questions for Master modules, 
- Member of the Widening Participation team of the School of Governmental Affairs. Our team aims to enhance the number of students from disadvantaged social backgrounds at our department. As a member of the team I am responsible for the organisation of a Summer School and Open Day for Year 10 students at the Department.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Fellow in Middle East Politics

profile_positions.description: As a committee member of the Firefly Palestine Committee, I am supporting Project Hope with report-writing, the development of an online media strategy and with marketing by creating new posters, infographics and organising and conducting talks about Project Hope in the United Kingdom and the Netherlands in coordination with the director of Project Hope and our alumni network.
profile_positions.title: Committee Member of the Palestine Committee

profile_positions.company: BPA Quality UK | Contact Centre Quality
profile_positions.description: As a Quality Evaluation Analyst I evaluated calls and chats in four languages (Dutch, English, French and German) in order to give our clients advice how to improve customer service. I provided coaching to new members of the team by advising them how to evaluate calls and chats and use our different software systems, while I was also selected to ensure the quality of our evaluations by providing feedback to my colleagues in terms of how they scored calls and chats. I also coordinated the allocation of chats & calls among the Dutch team, to ensure we met the targets of our clients. Furthermore, I was selected to conduct mystery calls for another client, in order to ensure the quality of their customer service.
profile_positions.title: Quality Evaluation Analyst

profile_positions.description: As a seasonal employee at the call centre of the Dutch division of ACTA Assistance in Lyon I provided road side emergency assistance to Dutch tourists stranded in France. In this position, I arranged together with my colleagues help to our clients to make sure they were taken off the road. Furthermore, I liaised between our Dutch clients, French garages and French car rental companies in order to make sure our clients could continue their journey with their repaired car or a rental car. In addition, I would make sure their vehicle would be transported safely to the Netherlands in case the reparation could not be completed during the stay of our client in France.
profile_positions.title: Seasonal Employee

company.name: Project Hope: Humanitarian Opportunities for Peace and Education

profile_positions.company: Project Hope: Humanitarian Opportunities for Peace and Education
profile_positions.description: As a Program Advisor, I supported Project Hope by compiling and submitting a successful application to the European Commission in order to obtain funding for the European Voluntary Service, liaising with a wide range of actors to receive all information required. I drafted the reports for Project Hope by collecting data from different sources, synthesized it and presented the data in line with the donor requirements. I was responsible for answering queries of donors and partner-organisations to Project Hope and coordinated the social media of Project Hope and its outreach strategy, by collecting photos and stories from international and local volunteers for publication on the website and Facebook-page.
profile_positions.title: Program Advisor

- Mapping out strengths and weaknesses of competitive events in ICT /logistic/military sector.

profile_positions.title: Project Assistant

company.name: PGR Seminar South West Doctoral Training Centre

volunteer_experiences.description: Successfully applied for funding of the South West Doctoral Training Centre to set-up Post-Graduate seminars at the University of Exeter, the University of Bristol and the University of Bath. The goal of these seminars is for PhD students to present their work, receive feedback and enhance inter-institutional cooperation in the Southwest.
As a treasurer at Machiavelli (a student magazine for Politics students at the University of Amsterdam), I drafted the budget of the organisation, conducted the payments and helped with fundraising.
